fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-2284].
  {panel}

Unless I am mistaken, you can either enable globally the JSD notification schemes, bypassing the tweaks you can do in a notification scheme, or you have to turn it off and revert to the project-level notification scheme.

Unfortunately, this also removes the JSD email templates. We have several service desks at the office, and one of those we don't want it to be chatty towards the customers. What I would have liked to do was to disable the emails to the reporter, but leave everything else as-is.

After much pondering I ended up keeping JSD notification set to ON globally, and setting the project-level notifications scheme to NONE. This solves some of the problem, but service desk agents won't get emails either when we assign to them. 

It'd be nice if we had more control over this, such as turning OFF the service desk notification scheme at the project level, or use the project notification scheme to control when the emails are sent (but not their format).
fields.summary: Ability to toggle Service Desk notification scheme at the project level

  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Users really dislike the fact that if they type a query in the landing page search box and then click away (say, to cut an paste something), the text they typed in is gone and they have to start from scratch again. It would be nice if this was not the case.

Screenshot before click away
!SearchContext_before.png|width=500!

Screenshot after click away
!SearchContext_after.png|width=500!

h3. Suggested Solution
Instead of auto clear you could auto select-all so that they have a choice of starting a new or adding to existing text.
fields.summary: As a user , search query at search landing page won't auto clear when click away

fields.description:
See: https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/24647091/difference-between-enable-service-desk-and-create-new-service-desk

Within JIRA it is possible to create a service desk in two ways:

1) Select the "Enable Service Desk" option in the project admin

2) Create a Service Desk -> New Service Desk Project

What strikes me (JIRA Service Desk 2.4.3) is that the queues are different depending on the way of creation: 

1) My open tickers, SLA at risk, SLA breached, Due soon

2) Unassigned issues, Assigned to me, Waiting on customer, Recently resolved
fields.summary: Difference between Enable Service Desk and Create New Service Desk

fields.description:
h3. Summary
JavaScript error is displayed on JIRA Agile Boards when you create an issue which is expected to show the following diagram, if you install JIRA Service Desk and if you use Japanese UI.
bq. Your issue <ISSUE_KEY> has been created but is not currently visible.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install vanilla JIRA 6.4.10 (current latest)
# Install JIRA Agile 6.7.11 (current latest) through 'Find new add-ons'
# Install JIRA Service Desk 2.5.4 (current latest) through 'Find new add-ons'
# Create a scrum board and create a project for the board
# Go to Profile and change the language to 日本語 (Japanese)
# Go to 'Active sprints' of the board
# Click '作成' (create) button at the header to open 'Create Issue' screen
# Fill the information on the screen and hit '作成' (create) to create the issue
# JavaScript error is displayed (see JavaScriptError.png)

h3. Expected Results
The new issue is created with the following message instead of the JavaScript error:
bq. Your issue <ISSUE_KEY> has been created but is not currently visible.

h3. Actual Results
No related information is logged in the atlassian-jira.log file
 
h3. Notes
- The issue is successfully created even though the JavaScript error is displayed
- The error does not happen when you use any language other than Japanese
- The error does not happen when you disable JIRA Service Desk
- The problem might relate to JSD-2016

h3.Workaround
- Ignore the JavaScript error because the issue is created successfully
- Use any language other than Japanese
fields.summary: JavaScript error is displayed on Agile Boards after installing JSD when using Japanese

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Service Desk email integration is creating new tickets even when there is the correct tags in the subject line. 

h3. Environment
* JIRA 6.4.11
* SDS 2.5.4

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install JIRA + Servicedesk mentioned above. 
# Enable [Public Signup|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/SERVICEDESK/Configuring+public+signup] + [email channel|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/SERVICEDESK/Receiving+requests+by+email] 
# Send _different_ email with the following subject line:
- \[ABC] (SD-123) CREATE ISSUE  
- Re: \[ABC] (SD-123) CREATE ISSUE 
- CREATE ISSUE \[ABC\] (SD-123) 
- Re: CREATE ISSUE \[ABC\] (SD-123)

h3. Expected Results
Email with the same subject line should be created as a comment instead of separate issue.

h3. Actual Results
Email is created as a separate ticket.
 
h3.Workaround
Reply directly to the email thread instead of sending a new mail with the same subject line.
fields.summary: ServiceDesk ignore email subject line and create separate ticket

fields.description:
h4. Summary
*Recently resolved* queue in Service Desk is using a wrong JQL query, which results in issues that has been resolved (_all_).

h4. Environment
JIRA Service Desk 2.5.4

h4. Steps to Reproduce
# Install JIRA
# Install JIRA Service Desk 2.5.4
# Navigate to the *Queues* page
# Go to the *Recently resolved* queue

h4. Expected Results
Issues that were resolved within the past 1 week will be returned

h4. Actual Results
Issues that has been resolved way back to the very first issue resolved
{code}
resolved <= 1w ORDER BY resolved DESC
{code}

h4. Workaround
Edit the queue, and use this query instead:
{code}
resolved >= -1w ORDER BY resolved DESC
{code}
fields.summary: Default 'Recently resolved' Queue is using a wrong JQL query

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-2263].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
As of the Service Desk 2.6.0-OD-10 release, the Confirmation Email sent to customers does not include information about the issue they've created; ie does not include Summary or Description.

The Customer receives a generic message indicating that a Request has been created and the Service Desk Ticket ID. 
!ConfirmationEmail.png|thumbnail!

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide Service Desk Admins the ability to modify the Email used by Service Desk or Include information (Summary and/or Description) about the initial request on the Confirmation Email sent out to Customers.
 
h3. Workaround 
none
fields.summary: Provide Summary and Description Information in Service Desk Confirmation Emails Sent to Customers

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-2262].
  {panel}

When mail can not be processed, due to the email not being from a known customer and not a public signup Service Desk, it would be useful if it is possible for an Admin or Agent to view those messages.

The Admin can currently see them in the Mail Audit Log, but not possible to action anything.

Would be useful if possible to:

* Choose to create a new customer from mail, and ticket
* Create a new customer and add as a Request Participant with comment to existing issue
* If attachments are corrupt or blocking an issue, select to skip attachments but create issue

*Summary*
When Assigning or Transitioning an issue, from the Service Desk queue view, +using the Old Navigation style+, the screen is greyed out and a spinning wheel stays on the screen indefinitely. The task doesn't complete on the browser but it does in the background.
A refresh is necessary to continue using JIRA. If the task is performed from the "New Navigation Style" or the default JIRA view, the task completes normally

*Environment:*
* Jira Service Desk Cloud
* Old Service Desk Navigation Style enabled

*Steps to reproduce*
# Create a new Service Desk project in JIRA Cloud
# Create a new issue in the project
# Change the navigation style by clicking on: "Switch back to old navigation" on the left column
# Click on "Assign to me" button
*Result:* A spinning wheel is shown indefinitely and an error is logged in the console
*Expected:* current user is assigned to issue and one can continue using JSD.

*Error:*
!browser_console_error.jpeg|thumbnail!

This error reads:
{noformat}
batch.js:12460 Uncaught TypeError: b is not a function
c @ batch.js:12460
h.onDialogFinished @ batch.js:12460
Dialog.extend._handleSubmitResponse @ batch.js:2614
Dialog.extend._handleInitialDoneResponse @ batch.js:2614
ajaxOptions.complete @ batch.js:2543
completeHandler @ batch.js:617
j @ batch.js:41
o.fireWith @ batch.js:43
c @ batch.js:167
b @ batch.js:179
{noformat}

*Workaround:*
* Use the New navigation style, by clicking on "Switch to new navigation"
* Refresh the page to resume work.
fields.summary: Infinite spinning wheel when assigning or transition issue from Old Navigation Style

fields.description:
Hi - I'm experiencing behavior in my customer portal that if a client submits a directory/file path or a url with the phrase "/images/" in it, it gets rewritten to /servicedesk/customershim/images in the portal. This doesn't happen to the JIRA Browse view of the issue, only the portal issue.

Is there some way to suppress this issue? We use our desk as tech support, and the ability to type real paths is relevant. Our users tend to not understand or know how to use wiki markup, so I'd like some ability to turn this behavior off on my end.

h3. Workaround

For external URLs create a TinyURL at http://tinyurl.com and use that for the link/image/URL instead.

For example, for the image http://www.dcrainmaker.com/images/2012/08/the-nuremberg-runaround-flock-of-sheep-edition.jpg
Created a TinyURL, http://tinyurl.com/q7bprar

Now it can be used in all the normal ways:

{code:type=mysql}
http://tinyurl.com/q7bprar
{{http://tinyurl.com/q7bprar}}
!http://tinyurl.com/q7bprar!
{code}

Result: [screenshot|https://www.evernote.com/l/AATj6M0YwZlAGbwHq6U3KmoSuZPAzv2mRpk]
fields.summary: Customer Portal alters text containing /images/

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-2257].
  {panel}

As a project admin, I'd like to be able to manage the "smarts" pre-populated texts on the comment section of an issue when an agent responds to a customer. 

When talking about manage, I mean:
- Set myself a default message.
- Set specific messages for each project.
- Enable/disable this feature as I like.

*Workaround to disable*

Enable the following dark feature from https://<instance-url>/SiteDarkFeatures!default.jspa: (in Cloud Atlassian Support will need to do this)

{noformat}
sd.email.conversational.notification.disabled
{noformat}


{panel:title=Service Desk Update - 12 October 2015}
Hi all,

We have added an option for agents to turn this functionality off as they wish in the 3.0.1, 3.1.0-OD-01 release. If you want to customise further, it's being tracked at https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSD-631.

Bests,
The JIRA Service Desk team
{panel}

{panel:title=Service Desk Update - 4 September 2015}
Hi all,

Thank you for all your feedback. Before launching this new feature, our goal was to make service desk notification more conversational. We’ve made a decision to move forward with helping agents save time with a friendly greeting and sign off with the agent name to make it more personal. We acknowledge that this functionality isn't for every agent and your desire to customize these responses.
So far we've added additional translation strings for German, French and Japanese. 
You can also help us in translating for your language here if it is missing https://translations.atlassian.com/. 
The string are:

{noformat}
sd.comment.prepopulated.default.greeting=Hi {0},
sd.comment.prepopulated.default.anonymous.greeting=Hi,
{noformat}

The ability to edit these responses will require a bit more thought, the immediate action for us is to provide an option for agents to turn this functionality off as they wish in the upcoming release. If you want to customise further, it's being tracked at https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSD-631.

Thanks for your patience and we hope you appreciate our open approach to feature requests.If you have further questions or comments, please feel free to contact me directly as well at jhuynh at atlassian dot com.

Bests,
The JIRA Service Desk team
{panel}

Comment avatars do not render in Customer Portal for users that are JIRA Users (this includes Agents as well as Customers that are also JIRA Users), or non JIRA User Customers that have added a custom avatar.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install JIRA. In my test instance, I installed JIRA 6.4.10
# Install JIRA Service Desk 2.5.4. In my test, I used an ABP license.
# Have a Service Desk created. In my test, I used the "My First Service Desk" that installed automatically.

# Open the Issue in the Customer Portal.

Non JIRA User customer avatars do not render as well, if they have customized them. If they use the default avatar, it will render.

h3. Expected Results
All avatars in the commentary area of the Customer Portal would render.

h3. Actual Results
See Screenshots. The avatars do not render, but instead have broken image icons.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-2245].
  {panel}

h5. Issue Summary:
If an agent is also a customer and he closes an issue that he raised from within JIRA (NOT Customer Portal). If there is a comment added in the resolve issue screen, the issue closes and then re-opens.

*Steps to reproduce*
- Create an issue as an agent in SD
- Assign the issue to yourself.
- Resolve and close the issue.
- Refresh the page.

*Expected Result*
Issue stays resolved based on selected resolution.

*Actual Result*
Issue gets resolved and gets re-opened immediately.

*Cause*
- The arrangement of the workflow post functions, places transitioning the issues in a higher position above add comment. (related to the order described [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRACLOUD/Advanced+workflow+configuration].

h3.Workaround
- Edit the *Transition on comment* Automation Rule at
-- {{https://<BASE_URL>.atlassian.net/servicedesk/agent/<PROJECT_ID>/settings/automation}}
- Manually add in the following (See screenshot):
{code}
ELSE IF
 issue matches: 
Status = Resolved and "Customer Request Type" is not empty
 Comment is Public
 User is customer
THEN
 Transition Issue
Reopen Issue
{code}
fields.summary: Automation Re-open on comment broken

  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

It is possible customer wants to reopen the case after ticket resolved. This can configured by automation, but sometimes after resolving the case, customer sends appreciation messages such as "Thanks" which reopens the case, 
So, if agent resolves the case again a notification will be sent to the customer which is not pleasant for customers.

h3. Solution 
Resolve a case without sending notification to customer.

fields.description:
{panel:title=Update|bgColor=#f5f5f5}
To address this issue, we are not able to change the existing JQL functions of running() and paused().

They would be relied upon for many other scenarios, in the existing behaviour. For SLAs, it is either running, unless completed or has matched a pause condition. When outside of working hours, it is essentially still running, just inactive.

Therefore, we will address this requirement, by adding a new JQL function withinWorkingHours() that will allow you to combine JQL functions to see if an issue is running and in/out of working hours.
{panel}


h3. Summary
Whenever an issue is created outside the hours configured in the calendar attached to the first SLA rule in the Service Desk, the issue will not be findable using the != running() or = paused JQL functions.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Service Desk
# Set the default "Time to resolution" SLA to use the "Sample 9-5 Calendar"
# Remove the current day from the "Sample 9-5 Calendar"
# Create an issue in the Service Desk
# Run the following JQL on the instance:
{code}
created > startofDay() AND ("Time to resolution" != running() OR "Time to resolution" = paused()
{code}

h3. Expected Results
The issue created at step 4 shows up as a result to the JQL at step 5

h3. Actual Results
The issue created at step 4 does not shows up as a result to the JQL at step 5

h3. Notes
The use case for this functionality, is to enable an automated comment on issues that have been created outside of configured SLA hours.
This will help set expectations to the reporters of these issues regarding the time before which their issues are not likely to get picked up.
For instance, if the first response SLA is set to run between 09:00 and 17:00, and an issue gets created at 23:00, the reporter should be notified of this
fields.summary: running() and paused() JQL functions do not properly work on newly created issues

h3. Summary
Clicking on suggested KB results in a pop up window and then the KB itself can't be scrolled, but the original page (at the background page is the one that scrolling instead).

h3. Environment
* Tested on iPhone 4, 5, 6
* Tested on Safari, Google Chrome

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to http://support.atlassian.com/
# At the "Find a solution", please type "Using Filter".

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-2234].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Looking for more Automation functionality that can be triggered on issue updates to extend Automation capabilities.

Example A
 # Customer creates a ticket
 # Agent triage's / edit meta data
 # Based on their selections I want to transition the workflow to a new status.

Example B
# Customer creates a ticket
# Agents changes the request type
# Based on the new request type, priority of this request should be automatically increased

h3. Suggested Solution

Automation rules could be triggered when an issue is updated, for added options of Automation.

h3. Workaround
 - Using Add-Ons such as: [Script Runner for JIRA|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.onresolve.jira.groovy.groovyrunner] or [JIRA Automation Plugin|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.plugin.automation.jira-automation-plugin]
 - Use a Formal 'Triage' workflow transition
fields.summary: Automation trigger on issue updates

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-2226].
  {panel}

As an admin, I would like to be able to add a (JIRA Dashboard?) gadget to the Service Desk customer portal.

Use case:
We have an [add-on for JIRA|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/no.resight.jira.plugins.mapit.mapit-plugin] that allows you to see JIRA issues in a map gadget, as well as create issues from the map. The point is to be able to track the location of where work needs to be done.

We think it would be useful to add this gadget to the JSD Customer portal, so that the customer reporting an issue could indicate the geographical location of the issue, and also see other issues in the same map. 

There are also other gadgets that could be useful to see on the customer portal, i.e. some of the chart gadgets in Jira.
fields.summary: Allow admins to add gadgets to Customer Portal

fields.description:
Hello,

we are using Jira 6.4.7 and 6.4.4 for our customers. Database is MsSql 2012 with CI_AI collation, but some fields in service desk are stripped from diacritics.

Those fields are:
* label for fields
* request type name
However, if you put these diacritis in name of the portal or description of portal everything works fine.

Steps to reproduce:
1) go to service desk settings
2) change request name to "Nový servisní požadavek"
3) the request name will be changed to "Novy servisní pozadavek"

I have found ticket JSD-1419 yet I am unable to find clean solutin for this, should I change the field definition from varchar to nvarchar for tables StatusMapping and ViewportField? Is it safe to change the definition on database level?

Can I get clean solution to this? I guess it is bug in Service desk because it works on portal name, but not for field names. 

Thanks for response.
fields.summary: Non-latin characters are stripped in customfield name and request type

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-2205].
  {panel}

According to [this answer|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/17898714/answers/17898868] we should not be seeing any sub-tasks in the customer portal. 

We are using workflow transition post functions to create two sub-tasks on the Create transition for issues in our Service Desk project. When an issue is created by a customer using the portal, these sub-tasks are visible as requests in the portal. Notification emails are also sent for the sub-tasks, resulting in 3 email notifications per request. 

We've tested the post functions with Bob Swift's Create on Transition plugin and Script Runner and believe this may be a bug in Service Desk. 

I've attached two screenshots. The transition screenshot shows the Service Desk request panel for a sub-task created via the post function. The manual screenshot shows the panel for a manual sub-task.

We do not see this behavior when sub-tasks are created manually by a Service Desk agent.
fields.summary: Sub-Tasks created by post functions appear as customer requests in the portal

There are a couple reasons that users are not added to Request Participants from email:

# They are in the 'to' or 'bcc' lines
# They are not registered as a user on the system

Right now, I believe the exception is logged, but there is no notification for either the reporter or the failed cc-user. There should be an option to notify these users what to do.
fields.summary: Graceful exception handling for users who are not added to request participants via email

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The *Request Participants customfield for service desk will write a blank entry into an issue's history even when the field has not be altered in any way.  

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Spin up an instance of JIRA 6.4.9 with Service Desk 2.5.3 
# Using the example issue in the *My First Service Desk* Service Desk (or any other ticket created in a Service Desk project), DESK-1, click on EDIT.
# Click on UPDATE without making any changes to the issue.
# Click in the History tab of the issue and note that there is an entry for the Request Participants field.

h3. Expected Results
The user would expect that there would be no entry at all in the History tab for the Request Participants field.

h3. Actual Results
There is a blank (no value) entry for the Request Participants field in the history tab.

h3.Workaround
There is no known workaround for this.
fields.summary: Request Participants field writes to issue history when no change to the field has been made.

h3. Problem Definition

Some organisations have high number of JIRA Service Desks projects and this number is growing. 
There is a lot of text on that page, and to a user who is not super comfortable in the environment (often the people who are seeing support) it can be a little intimidating. The icon represents a point of reference or a "brand" a user can look for when they visit the desk.
There are many users raising tickets in the wrong JIRA Service Desk project. So this change might compound that issue.
When organisation has many SD projects, icons make it much quicker to find the right one
fields.summary: Each Service Desk Project To Have Icon At Help Center

fields.description:
h5. Issue Summary:
When a user adds a group of users or user to the JIRA Service Desk Role "Service Desk Team" Through {{Project > My Project > Administration > Roles}} page, all users added in are added to the Service Desk collaborator group when you view the role within {{Service Desk > Your Project > People}} page.

Also tested adding the users to "Service Desk Collaborators" role, they are still added as collaborators.

This is a bug when we look at the definition explained in our documentation and from testing older version (2.4.3 and 2.3.6):
bq. *Service Desk Team*: This role contains the agents on a service desk. 

*Expected Behaviour*
Users added to the role are made Service Desk agents.

*Actual Result*
Users are added to Service Desk collaborator group.
fields.summary: Project Role "Service Desk Team" adds users as collaborators

fields.description:
{panel:title=Update as of 23 October 2015|bgColor=#f5f5f5}
This has been fixed, and relies on the underlying JIRA version.

Therefore, the fix will be available along with JIRA 7.1.0. This should be available to Cloud customers within 2 - 3 weeks, and a bit longer for Server customers.
{panel}

h3. Problem Definition

The formatting works fine with no issue in JIRA, but sending it as notification over Email has issue.
Within a Color block, using noformat will affect the rest of the text.
It seems that noformat goes until the end of the text and can't be closed.
For instance using the below format(You need to click on this text box to see the raw formatting):

{color:blue}

I am blue!
I am Blue!

{noformat}I am not blue because of no format. I am happy! {noformat}

I want to be blue, but can't :-(

I want to be blue too, but can't :/

{color}

Here is the text on JIRA
!WikiJIRA.jpg|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Result

After noformat block, the rest of the text should be colored in blue.

h3. Actual Result

Rest of the text after block of noformat loose the color.
!WikiEmail.jpg|thumbnail!

Refer to attachments.
fields.summary: Wiki Markup {noformat} Does Not End Within A Text On Email

# Allow any users in To and CC fields that are not already Service Desk consumers to have accounts created for them.
# Another problem is that if a mail is to long can we attach mail to an issue. But this attechment can be viewed in Outlook.
# We want to delete assiagne from mail templetes but we didnt find JSD mail templates.

Thanks.

fields.description:
h4. Summary
If the SLA custom field is added into the Create/Edit screen in Service Desk Screen Scheme, *editing any field of an issue* will cause SLA panel to be missing

h4. Environment
JIRA 6.4.7
JIRA Service Desk 2.5.2

h4. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to *Administration > Issues > Screens*
# Configure the *JIRA Service Desk Screen for Project <SDProject>*
# Add *Time to Resolution* SLA custom field into the screen
# Create new Service Desk request
# From the queue view, edit any field on the newly raised issue

h4. Expected Results
Issue details will be updated

h4. Actual Results
Issue details updated, and SLA Panel and the custom field is also missing
!slapanel.gif|thumbnail!

h4. Notes
The issue doesn't happen if SLA custom field is not added into the screen
fields.summary: SLA panel gone after editing an issue

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h5. Issue Summary
When an issue is created, via email and JIRA has the email configured as POP, the expected behaviour would be that all mails that come in and are successfully processed are deleted from the mail client.

If these mails are not processed(for example due to the email owner not being a customer in a private portal), then such mails are meant to be left as is and not market as read or deleted.

However in my test, JIRA Service Desk would leave all mails as is even if they are successful in Gmail if the user specifies the option "Keep a Gmail copy", while on the other hand it would delete all emails(processed or not) if the option states that is should "Delete Gmail copy".

h5. Steps to Reproduce.
# Set up a Service Desk Project.
# Disable public Sign up and set it to Private.
# Set up a "Secure Pop" gmail, email channel.
#- Leave option in Gmail as default "Keep Gmail Copy"
# Send an email to the portal channel
#- *Result*: Email is not deleted from the email inbox whether processed or not.
# Change the Email option to " Delete Gmail Copy"
#- *Result*: Email is are deleted from the email inbox whether processed or not.

*Problem*
This prevents Admin from knowing what mails are processed and which are not.
fields.summary: JIRA Service Desk Mail doesn't work as documented

h2. Workaround
# Check if you have none entries on the *FROM_ORDER_ (From *AO_54307E_VIEWPORTFORM* table) and _FIELD_ORDER_  (From *AO_54307E_VIEWPORTFIELD* table)
{code:sql}SELECT * FROM "AO_54307E_VIEWPORTFORM" {code}
{code:sql}SELECT * FROM "AO_54307E_VIEWPORTFIELD"{code}
# If you don’t have any entries, you can proceed adding them as the following example:
(i) Notice that this is just an example, you may have to modify _Integer_ from *FROM_ORDER* and *FIELD_ORDER* based on your results.
{code:sql}UPDATE "AO_54307E_VIEWPORTFORM" SET "FORM_ORDER" ='0' WHERE "ID" = '1'; {code}
{code:sql}UPDATE "AO_54307E_VIEWPORTFIELD" SET "FIELD_ORDER" = '0' WHERE "ID" = '1'; {code}
{code:sql}UPDATE "AO_54307E_VIEWPORTFIELD" SET "FIELD_ORDER" = '1' WHERE "ID" = '2'; {code}

fields.description:
*Issue Sumary*
When an SD project is set to viewable by anonymous via project permission, internal comments are also viewable.

*Steps to Reproduce*
# Create a Service Desk project.
# Create an issue in the project.
# Add an internal comment into the project.
# Add group "Anyone" to the project's Browse issue permission.
# Access the Search issue page and find issues within that project.
# View the issue you created.

*Expected Result*
JIRA would allow users veiw issue showing all unhidden comments but hide internal comments similar to restricted comments in JIRA.

*Actual Result*
Anonymous user sees all comments in the issue.
fields.summary: Internal comments should only be viewable by specific users from JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-2165].
  {panel}

The JEPP code base can throw NPEs during JIRA Service Desk startup, but only some times.

The exception looks like this

{quote}
Failure simplicity.atlassian.net: JIRA is 503 Server Error: Service Unavailable
	com.atlassian.servicedesk:sd-general-health-check: The internal modules have failed to start : NullPointerException:
 java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.atlassian.jira.internal.mail.processor.feature.channel.MailChannelStore.getMailChannelByKey(MailChannelStore.java:63)
	at com.atlassian.jira.internal.mail.processor.feature.channel.MailChannelManager.getMailChannelDefinitionByKey(MailChannelManager.java:270)
	at com.atlassian.jira.internal.mail.processor.feature.channel.DefaultChannelManager.getMailChannelByKey(DefaultChannelManager.java:46)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)

	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:179)
	at org.eclipse.gemini.blueprint.service.util.internal.aop.ServiceTCCLInterceptor.invokeUnprivileged(ServiceTCCLInterceptor.java:70)
	at org.eclipse.gemini.blueprint.service.util.internal.aop.ServiceTCCLInterceptor.invoke(ServiceTCCLInterceptor.java:53)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:179)
	at org.eclipse.gemini.blueprint.service.importer.support.LocalBundleContextAdvice.invoke(LocalBundleContextAdvice.java:57)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:179)
	at org.springframework.aop.support.DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.doProceed(DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.java:133)
	at org.springframework.aop.support.DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.invoke(DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.java:121)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:179)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.JdkDynamicAopProxy.invoke(JdkDynamicAopProxy.java:207)
	at com.sun.proxy.$Proxy2999.getMailChannelByKey(Unknown Source)
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.feature.emailchannel.emailplatform.JEPP.JEPPServiceImpl.getMailChannelByKey(JEPPServiceImpl.scala:26)
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.feature.emailchannel.emailplatform.EmailChannelSettingTestValidator.validMailChannel(EmailChannelSettingTestValidator.scala:66)
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.feature.emailchannel.emailplatform.EmailPlatformChannelManagerImpl.com$atlassian$servicedesk$internal$feature$emailchannel$emailplatform$EmailPlatformChannelManagerImpl$$isBrokenEmailChannelSetting(EmailPlatformChannelManagerImpl.scala:329)
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.feature.emailchannel.emailplatform.EmailPlatformChannelManagerImpl$$anonfun$getValidOnDemandEmailChannels$1.apply(EmailPlatformChannelManagerImpl.scala:309)
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.feature.emailchannel.emailplatform.EmailPlatformChannelManagerImpl$$anonfun$getValidOnDemandEmailChannels$1.apply(EmailPlatformChannelManagerImpl.scala:309)
	at scala.collection.TraversableLike$$anonfun$filter$1.apply(TraversableLike.scala:264)
	at scala.collection.immutable.List.foreach(List.scala:318)
	at scala.collection.TraversableLike$class.filter(TraversableLike.scala:263)
	at scala.collection.AbstractTraversable.filter(Traversable.scala:105)
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.feature.emailchannel.emailplatform.EmailPlatformChannelManagerImpl.getValidOnDemandEmailChannels(EmailPlatformChannelManagerImpl.scala:309)
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.feature.emailchannel.emailplatform.EmailPlatformChannelManagerImpl.checkODEmailChannelConnectivityAndUpdateExpiredPasswords(EmailPlatformChannelManagerImpl.scala:113)
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.feature.emailchannel.EmailChannelManagerDelegator.checkODEmailChannelConnectivityAndUpdateExpiredPasswords(EmailChannelManagerDelegator.scala:44)
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.email.mailstore.ODMailStoreChecker.verifyAndUpdateODMailSettingsPassword(ODMailStoreChecker.java:20)
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.bootstrap.lifecycle.TenantAwareneODMailInitialiser.initialize(TenantAwareneODMailInitialiser.java:59)
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.bootstrap.lifecycle.PluginLifeCycle.loadSuccessModules(PluginLifeCycle.java:424)
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.bootstrap.lifecycle.PluginLifeCycle.loadDynamicModules(PluginLifeCycle.java:378)
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.bootstrap.lifecycle.PluginLifeCycle.runPluginStartupSideEffectsImpl(PluginLifeCycle.java:341)
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.bootstrap.lifecycle.PluginLifeCycle.access$000(PluginLifeCycle.java:38)
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.bootstrap.lifecycle.PluginLifeCycle$1.run(PluginLifeCycle.java:272)
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.bootstrap.lifecycle.LifecycleLock.writeImpl(LifecycleLock.java:115)
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.bootstrap.lifecycle.LifecycleLock.runOnStartup(LifecycleLock.java:87)
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.bootstrap.lifecycle.PluginLifeCycle.runPluginStartupSideEffects(PluginLifeCycle.java:267)
{quote}

The code is blowing up here

{code}
    Option<MailChannelDTO> getMailChannelByKey(final Option<TransactionContext> txnContext, ChannelKey key)
    {
        final SelectClauseProvider clauseProvider = SelectClauseProvider.builder()
                .where(table.MAIL_CHANNEL_KEY.eq(key.getKey()))
                .build();

{code}

Its either the key variable is null or the table variable.  I suspect its the table variable.

Here is what I think is happening

* the JEPP API is made available via OSGi and JSD starts calling on it
* however the JEPP plugin has not started yet and has not run its init code
* that init code makes sure the AO is present and then calls queryDslHelper.init();
* this then inits the "table" variable above

Normally this works because JEPP starts before JSD say and this is all done before the caller can invoke API services.

The recent JIRA 7.x lifecycle changes have made this problem more likely but its always been present.  We have a number of internal tickets reporting this problem.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-2156].
  {panel}

h5. Issue Summary
- Customer set up an SLA where they want to send a notification when an SLA is about to be breached to specific users.

Set up:
# Create an Automation Rule 
# In the If section, add issue created
# In the When section, Add a condition like: {code}status in (Open, Reopened, "Waiting for customer","Waiting for support","In Progress", "In Review","To Do") AND "Time to resolution" = "2h" //Checking for issues in one of these statuses that is about to breach(or in essence time remaining before it breaches is 2 hours){code}
# In the Then section add an Alert user condition and add a user who is an Agent.

*Expected Result*
- JIRA would send a notification to the user specified when the SLA has 2 h left.

*Actual Result*
- No notification is sent.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-2155].
  {panel}

h5. Issue Summary
I have a customer who would like to send notifications via the alert functionality made available by automation in Service Desk.

However the condition for sending it cannot be fulfilled because JIRA JQL only allows Customer Request Type when queried to check if it is empty or not.

*What is Needed*
* User should be able to query against the string of customer request type.
* For example: {{"Customer Request Type" = "Get IT help"}}

*Usage Scenario*
If User files issue of Request Type A, Manager in charge of department A should be alerted about the issue.

Due to the inability to check the string itself, this is impossible.
fields.summary: Improve function of  query of Customer Request Type
